info.orestes.rest.conversion

Class ConverterFormat<F>

  • java.lang.Object
    • info.orestes.rest.conversion.ConverterFormat<F>
  • Type Parameters:
    F - the format that this ConverterFormat can produces and consume
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    StringFormat

    public abstract class ConverterFormat<F>
extends java.lang.Object
    A ConverterFormat is used to read a format from a ReadableContext and write a format to a WritableContext. The format is themself is generated form Converters before it is written and processd by Converters after it is read.

    In addition a ConverterFormat keeps a collection of all compatible Converters that can process the ConverterFormat

      ConverterFormat(java.lang.String converterPackageName)
      Creates a new ConverterFormat which Converters are located and automatically loaded from the specified package when this ConverterFormat is added to the ConverterService

      • get

        public <T> Converter<T,F> get(java.lang.Class<T> type,
                              java.lang.Class<?>[] genericParams)
                       throws UnsupportedMediaType
        Returns a compatible Converter that can handle the given java type
        Type Parameters:
        T - The java type to get the Converter for
        Parameters:
        type - The java types class to get the Converter for
        genericParams - If the java type is generic, the used types to convert the generic java type
        Returns:
        A Converter which can convert between this format and the given java type
        Throws:
        UnsupportedMediaType - if no converter is available to handle the conversion
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the genericParams count does not match the expected generics count declared by the java type

      • write

        public abstract void write(WritableContext context,
                           F formatedContent)
                    throws java.io.IOException
        Writes the java type content to the WritableContext
        Parameters:
        context - The WritableContext where the writer is used to write the content
        formatedContent - The formated content which will be written
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if an error occurred while writing the content
